text: Southern pylon of the Eyachtal Span The Eyachtal Span is the crossing of the Eyach valley with a 110 kV line in Neuenbürg and Höfen an der Enz in the Black Forest in Germany. The Eyachtal Span was built in 1992. With a span of 1444 metres, it is the greatest span of a power line in Germany. The pylons on which the Eyach Span is fixed are 70 metres high and located on Heuberg and Eiberg. ==External links== * Category:Powerline river crossings Category:Electric power transmission systems in Germany
title: Eyachtal Span
